attributes.action: Support Finance Bill Amendment to stop no-deal Brexit without Commons approval.
attributes.background: A cross-party group of MPs has tabled an amendment to the finance bill designed to stop the UK leaving the EU without a deal. The amendment would require: a Brexit deal; an extension of article 50; or a commons vote specifically approving a no deal Brexit - thus preventing no-deal without approval.
attributes.additional_details: Further information can be found:  https://www.theguardian.com/politics/live/2018/dec/20/brexit-latest-theresa-may-andrea-leadsom-makes-case-for-managed-no-deal-politics-live?page=with:block-5c1ba91de4b0cebe76178870#block-5c1ba91de4b0cebe76178870

attributes.action: Pass a new law on access to evidence so the wrongly convicted can get justice
attributes.background: Too often, police and prosecutors are failing to disclose crucial evidence, which means that innocent people end up in prison while the guilty walk free.
attributes.additional_details:
Yet under the current law, it is almost impossible for innocent prisoners to win back their freedom by accessing evidence wrongly withheld from them.
 
Disclosure failings are the biggest cause of miscarriages of justice. A former CPS head said potentially thousands of innocent people are languishing in our prisons due to failures to hand over evidence to the defence.
 
To ensure justice for wrongly convicted victims of disclosure failings, Parliament should pass a new law giving convicted defendants the right to access all non-sensitive material held by the police and CPS on their case and to instruct special counsel to inspect sensitive files.

attributes.action: Stop whilst in hospital exorbitant TV, phone and internet charges
attributes.background: We want the government to address the exorbitant prices that are taxed on ill people whilst in hospital, it is unacceptable for ill and terminally ill patient paying unrealistic charges for these services and then lining the pockets of companies based outside the UK

attributes.action: The government should stop ALL foreign aid now!
attributes.background: Issues at home are more important.
attributes.additional_details:
Foreign aid is given to India and they have a space programme 
Foreign aid is given to Pakistan, where Christians have been persecuted
Money should be spent on the NHS, pensions, policing etc.

attributes.action: Require drivers to pass the UK driving test to be able to drive in the UK
attributes.background: The reason I believe that drivers from overseas should take the UK driving test is because there are too many accidents on the UK roads caused by drivers from overseas because the roads in the UK are different to many other countries.

attributes.action: Work with airlines and other countries to make all planes have disabled toilets
attributes.background: Why should disabled people only have short haul holidays and not drink on the flight? Surely this is discrimination. The UK Government must work with other countries to make airlines commit to making all planes accessible to disabled people.

attributes.action: Urge Saudi government to reduce pilgrimage fees
attributes.background: The British government should help British Muslims by passing the message to the Saudi government that British Muslims are not happy with the Umrah fee. Not every Muslim can’t afford to pay the extra fee
attributes.additional_details: Umrah is a spiritual journey for every Muslim all around the world, but for the last two years the Saudi government has made it harder for Muslims. It’s British parliament responsibility to raise our views with the Saudi government.

attributes.action: Make it law that savings interest rates go up same time as loans & mortgages.
attributes.background: This last decade's rock-bottom interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest, because banks are quick to raise rates on loans & mortgages after BoE hikes, but are reluctant to offer the same, timely hikes for savings. Savers see this as immoral an highway robbery on our High Streets.
attributes.additional_details:
Before the 2008 crisis, from 1998 to 2007, savers earned £233 billion in interest. Following it, from 2008 to 2017, they earned just £129 billion because banks fail to pass on rate rises announced by the BoE.
Interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest payments https://dailym.ai/2ot5PJ3 
Millions of savers are being hit by rip-off rates https://dailym.ai/2PzyEin
 
We request that our MP's debate this in Parliament and create a new law that will enforce timely equitable treatment for interest rates on savings and retrospectively make good the deficit.

attributes.action: Give students free dental care and prescriptions on the NHS
attributes.background: Most students do not have any income, or if they do it is very minimal. Most students cannot afford dental treatment or prescriptions and avoid going to the doctors or dentist. This can mean that medical problems can go untreated and thus cost the NHS more in the long term.

attributes.action: Change the UK voting system to a legal requirement to increase voting turnout
attributes.background: Making voting a legal requirement will increase the turnout, making more uk citizens happier with the results. Currently, only 60% of the registered voters take part, which leaves 40% unhappy with the turnout as that have not cast a vote. We would like to change this and make voting compulsory.

attributes.action: Make parental alienation a criminal offence
attributes.background: Parental alienation should be included in the definition of the offence of Controlling or Coercive Behaviour. The current offence doesn’t include control through children such as changing arrangements and no shows.

attributes.action: Ban escort review websites like UK Punting
attributes.background: On certain online escort review discussion boards, such as UK Punting, users submit aggressive & potentially defamatory posts about women. These websites ask for reviews to contain a link, contact details or address of the escort, which can put them at risk.
attributes.additional_details: The posts may contain unfounded accusations and fake reviews. Pictures of the escorts can be posted without consent. Such sites are dangerous to ALL women, not just sex workers. Appearing on them can lead to women being harassed, outed and having their addresses made public, which could result in criminal damage and burglary. Users can even post pictures of women in the street and give derogatory accounts of what they would like to do to them in locked sections of these forums.

attributes.action: Integrate Physical and Mental Health
attributes.background: It seems logical, but people can have both physical and mental health problems. Yet many mental health units do not allow for or accommodate physical health needs or disabilities. It's 2018, so surely we should be able to provide care for people with complex or multiple needs...
attributes.additional_details: I am detained in a mental health unit currently, and am often unable to take leave because I use a wheelchair and the hospital drive is too steep for a manual wheelchair. Many units are unable to accommodate wheelchair users at all, and those that do often struggle to provide equal access, consistent access to physio, or other adaptations. This may mean some young people, purely because of their physical health needs, are sent to elderly mental health wards! THIS NEEDS TO CHANGE!!!

attributes.action: Give full time members of the armed forces a council tax exemptions
attributes.background: Service personnel who live in a property that is not on a base have to pay council tax, however many of these due to where they are based actually live in these addresses minimally. they have to pay SILCOT the armed forces equivalent of council tax, as such they effectively pay double council tax

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for social/news outlets to host any material of any child abuse
attributes.background: Failing to censor this material on platforms that are at so many peoples’ fingertips normalises this behaviour and perpetuates child abuse. Social and news medias have a responsibility to protect the vulnerable. These platforms must stop putting revenue before child safety by reporting and censoring
attributes.additional_details: Recent channel 4 Dispatches found that Facebook's moderators were not removing child physical abuse images from its platform, they merely place a warning on the images. Similarly, the mail online recently showed a graphic video of a mother beating her twins for profit. It is my belief that by leaving this kind of footage on media, whereby you needn’t seek it out, desensitises the public, normalises this behaviour and justifies mimicking. Any abuse of children should be taken as seriously as sex abuse

attributes.action: Ban Zero Hour Contracts for all 3rd Party Dock Workers and Stevedores.
attributes.background:
The National Dock Labour Board,
set up in 1947, registered all port
workers and guaranteed that dockers
had a basic minimum fallback wage,
whether there was work for them or
not.  In 1989 the Tory Goverment used legislation to remove these rights to fall back pay.
attributes.additional_details:
Ports continue to use 3rd Party Dock Workers through agencies who only provide zero hour contracts.  The ports side step any labour issues by claiming they do not employ these people the agencies do.
Zero hour contracts lead to unsafe practices as training and experience is often lost as these skills are replaced by the untrained and inexperienced staff.   People die in this industry because of this.

attributes.action: Enforce LGV's to the inside lane on major dual carriageway routes at PEAK times.
attributes.background:
Such as the A38 Birmingham to Derby & the A50 from Nottingham to Stoke. It is clear from travelling on the A14 where this was trailed and later enforced that it works.
This SAVES LIVES, emergency services resources & reduces insurance renewals (from fewer RTC's).

attributes.action: Make sharps disposal bins free of charge to collect.
attributes.background: I am starting this petition to make the collection of sharps disposal bins free of charge.
attributes.additional_details: I'm starting this petition because I am a type 1 diabetic and I have to use a sharps disposal bin for my insulin cartridges, needles, blood test strips and my blood testing pen drums. Because this is a lot of sharps wastage i end up filling a sharps bin within a couple weeks.The collection of sharps bins used to be free of charge but now there not, you can only have 2 free collections per 12 months and any other collections after would be £5 each time, so I would end up spending £30 or even more per year because I have a lot of sharps wastage from my diabetic stuff. I find this very unfair for anyone who uses a sharps disposal bin as no one chooses to be ill and have to use sharps bin for their wastage and some people might not be able to afford it.

attributes.action: Ban plastic bags
attributes.background:
The solution:
A law was introduced in October 2015 to have a 5p charge on plastic bags and are now planning to raise the charge to 10p in January 2020. This law has failed to significantly reduce waste. So what is the simple solution to all of this? Ban plastic bags all together by January 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
The issue:
Once we are finished with our plastic bags, we throw them in the bin ready for them to be taken to landfill. When they reach landfill, birds often mistake shredded plastic bags for food filling their stomachs with toxic debris. When a plastic bag reaches the ocean turtles cannot tell the difference between a jellyfish or a plastic bag. 91% of plastic waste isn’t recycled, meaning that the majority Virtually every piece of plastic that was ever made still exists in some shape or form.

attributes.action: All ‘fox’ hunts to be filmed by 3rd party, to ensure compliance with Hunting Act
attributes.background: Hunting of wild animals using dogs was made illegal in 2004, yet many continue to do it. Alternative hunts have been created in which dogs follow pre-placed scents, however many still attack wild animals. We believe the following further measures need to be taken:
attributes.additional_details:
- Dogs taking part in the hunt should be muzzled. They are only animals and do not know they should be following the pre-placed scent. It is the owners’ responsibility to ensure wild animals aren’t harmed.
- Hunts should be filmed. The whole hunt should be filmed, paid for by the organised hunt group, and the footage reviewed by a third party to make sure it is compliant with 2004 Hunting Act. Any illegal activity should be passed over to the police for prosecution.

attributes.action: Ban the use of single use plastic inside of cereal boxes
attributes.background: Most cereal comes packaged in plastic. The single use plastic bags not only are disposable and have a negative impact of our environment, but are unnecessary. Paper bags or no bags at all should be enough as the box contains all the contents.
attributes.additional_details: By stopping the use of plastic packaging inside cereal boxes, it will save the companies money, help reduce the pollution in our oceans and environment, and lower the amount of trash individuals and families produce. Alternatively, paper bags could be recycled and remade into more bags, creating a closed loop recycling system.

attributes.action: A general election to be called and a no deal to be put in place immediatly
attributes.background: A general election should be called and a no deal annouced. The people should have the right to vote to see which party should take us forward after the EU brexit deadline has passed

attributes.action: Funding help for clients attending private practice for mental health issues
attributes.background: Clients attend private practice for Counselling/Psychotherapy as advised by GP/NICE guidance and most need help with funding due to financial constraints. Long waiting lists of more than 6 months for charities and other voluntary services. Immediate intervention needed to prevent complex issues
attributes.additional_details: NICE guidance states that individuals struggling with mental health conditions such as anxiety and depression etc benefit from Counselling/Psychotherapy.  Early interventions and home treatment for mental health problems can reduce hospital admissions, shorten hospital stays and require fewer high-cost intensive interventions. This can potentially result in a saving of up to £38 million per year.

attributes.action: Prevent drug-related overdose deaths: trial supervised drug consumption rooms
attributes.background: Supervised drug consumption facilities have been successfully operating in Europe for 30 years. They reduce the risks of disease transmission through unhygienic injecting, prevent drug-related overdose deaths & connect high-risk drug users with treatment and other health and social services.
attributes.additional_details:
Drug Consumption Rooms also seek to contribute to a reduction in drug use in public places and the presence of discarded needles and other related public order problems linked with open drug scenes. Typically, drug consumption rooms provide drug users with: sterile injecting equipment; counselling services before, during and after
drug consumption; emergency care in the event of overdose; and primary medical care and referral to appropriate social healthcare and addiction treatment services.

attributes.action: Allow income tax relief for home owners.
attributes.background: Currently landlords obtain Income Tax Relief on residential property financing costs.   As far as I am aware this is not available for a mortgage on somebody's home.   Please give home owners a similar type of income tax relief on their home.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/restricting-finance-cost-relief-for-individual-landlords/restricting-finance-cost-relief-for-individual-landlords

attributes.action: Remove the Variable Speed limits from the motorways & remove all speed cameras
attributes.background: I have investigated the new emerging smart motorways across the UK and their use of variable speed limits & legend signs. I believe they are being misused and are causing a nuisance to drivers. The new system does not work, is chaotic & has major fallacies. The law harms innocent drivers.
attributes.additional_details: I have gathered a massive volume of evidence specifically in researching & investigating the Police, Highways & Council departments for required work I needed to perform for this petition. The work is conducted & directed by me in support of my right to petition."

attributes.action: Don't add the age verification and censoring on porn sites
attributes.background:
The government plans to add age verification and censoring on porn sites. 

We believe this is censorship via a back door.

We believe this will mean the UK will block many sites (just like China does).
attributes.additional_details:
It will increase pirated and probably illegal porn as it will end up only the criminals supplying porn.

We see each day sites hacked and data leaked, so we fear peoples details will be leaked online.

attributes.action: Abolish ‘Swedish derogation’ rule & give temp and agency workers equal rights
attributes.background: Agencies are increasing their profits every year while temp and agency workers go without pay rises, without full paid holidays and with a huge gap in benefits between themselves and permanent workers in the same employment.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.rec.uk.com/news-and-policy/corporate-blog/swedish-derogation-contracts-to-come-under-scrutiny-in-2018

attributes.action: Give UK armed forces recognition of their service during the cold war
attributes.background: Give UK armed forces personnel the same recognition as the rest of the world has done for their service during the cold war by allowing a medal too be issued.
attributes.additional_details: For all personnel who served past and present.

attributes.action: Offer free paediatric and adult first aid courses
attributes.background: Currently, first aid courses can prove quite expensive. When faced with someone in need, many don't have the confidence or knowledge to give first aid. Free courses can provide everyone with the skills and mentality, and allow them to be able to assist with first aid when needed.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 5 people will be faced with someone who needs immediate cpr throughout their lives, yet only 39% say they are able to perform cpr. Every minute that passes increases mortality. By offering these courses It allows those who may not have the confidence, knowledge or funding to be able to intervene in situations where lives are at risk, and hopefully, make a difference.

attributes.action: Transfer the responsibility of A422 Brackley - Banbury to Highways England
attributes.background: The section of the A422 between Brackley and Banbury is used quite heavily by all forms of transport at the moment the road is under Northamptonshire Highways, and not Highways England, plans for a Farthinghoe By Pass have yet to materialise.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment the road is closed for a small bridge repair near Farthinghoe.
Which  is causing chaos with minor roads unsuitable for use of high traffic volumes. The road is also a diversion route for M40 Traffic from Junction 10 to 11 vice versa when road accidents occur on the motorway between those junctions.

attributes.action: Parliament debate on the Right of Reply of people attacked in daily newspapers
attributes.background: It is intolerable and unfair that individuals attacked and criticised in the daily newspapers in the UK are not presently afforded the Right of Reply in said newspapers.
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is deemed necessary to debate whether individuals attacked in the UK mass media should be afforded an automatic Right of Reply to respond and the editors of the relevant newspapers should be made by law to publish those individuals replies with space afforded equal to the column size of the original articles which attacked them.

attributes.action: Scrap QTS professional skills test for those with learning disabilities.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of prospective teachers wanting to teach in various subjects apply for teacher training in the U.K. As a requirement set by the government, they are required  to undertake the Numeracy and Literacy QTS Professional Skills Test.
attributes.additional_details: For many people this may not cause any issues. However,  for the prospective teachers who have a learning disability struggle to the point where passing the test is out of their reach. I and many others believe this to be discrimination against those with a disability, as they are being turned away from pursuing their teaching career through no fault of their own. Therefore, I would like to propose that those with a learning disability, be exempt from QTS Professional Skills Tests.

attributes.action: All councils should be required by law to collect waste bins once per week
attributes.background: Many councils choose to collect bins every 2 weeks. This results in bin bags being stacked up on the ground, which creates a hatchery for flies. Fly eggs become adult flies in as little as 10 days, so this collection period allows full generations to grow, transferring disease to humans.
attributes.additional_details: Flies carry bacteria that is very harmful to humans, including salmonella, typhoid, gastroenteritis, E.coli, dysentery and even tuberculosis. They can also carry viruses and even parasitic worms. They transfer these to humans by landing in dirty environments such as bins, dead animals, and animal waste, and then landing on our food and food preparation surfaces, cutlery and plates on draining boards, tap handles, etc. The transfer happens within seconds of them landing on a surface.

attributes.action: Make it a mandatory minimum age of 18 to join all social media platforms.
attributes.background:
Children under the age of 18 are exposed to adult content, videos of violence and sexual content on social media sites, some that have age requirements of 13 years to join.
This is damaging to society.
attributes.additional_details: Social media is being used as a tool to promote gang culture, knife crime and robbery and being openly available to view on apps like Snapchat, Facebook and Instagram. Young girls are exposed to sexual content and images that are digitally altered, which has a huge effect on mental health. 18 years old should be a minimum age to engage on these platforms.

attributes.action: Make politics easier to understand for younger people
attributes.background: Finding out what each party want to do, especially online, is extremely tricky. There is a lot of jargon, and no website that lays out policies in a simple to understand way. I am a young, totally blind, person in my 20's and the system has left me very confused.
attributes.additional_details: During the 2017 general election, I realized that it was getting difficult for me to find party policies and for me to make up my mind. I propose the Government establish a website that allows users to look at summaries of party policies in a clear, concise, easy to understand, and most importantly, unbiased, way. At the end of these short policy summaries should be a link to that party's full manifesto. I believe that doing this, will allow young people to engage with politics on a much easier level.

attributes.action: Immediate Brexit referendum needing 66% majority (4 options and 1st/2nd choice)
attributes.background:
4 Options: (A) Th. May’s deal (B) Renegotiate with the EU (if the EU declines -> Hard Brexit) (C) Hard Brexit (D) Remain

People vote 1st and 2nd choice
If 1st choice >66% majority - DONE. 
If not, least popular option is removed and 2nd choice taken into account >66% - DONE
and so on
attributes.additional_details:
Immediate as we have had 2yrs of "campaign" no need for more
Invalid responses:
“This is not what the electorate voted when they voted to leave”. The IN/OUT vote did not allow OUT voters to explain their limits. It is a disgrace to hijack the outcome suggesting to understand every OUT voter
“We must respect the will of the people and the democratic process which delivered this result”. (1) the will of the people is not static (2) the political class has failed to in any way create consensus

attributes.action: Remove the 20% VAT on all e-books.
attributes.background: There is no VAT on physical books so it was unfair for the European Union to apply it to e-books in 2015.

attributes.action: Make new car led lights less bright
attributes.background: Old style lights on cars worked fine. Now driving at night had become quite dangerous for other road users especially  motorcyclists. Many occasions I’ve had to come to a near stop until the other car has passed. Something needs to be done.
attributes.additional_details: Two thirds of Britain’s drivers complain they are regularly dazzled by the headlights of modern vehicles, according to a new report today. Some 65 per cent of more than 2,000 motorists surveyed say they regularly get dazzled by oncoming headlights even though they are dipped.And fifteen per cent of motorists surveyed by the RAC claim they have suffered a near-miss as a result of being dazzled by modern headlights that they believe are too bright.

attributes.action: Discuss how supported employment can be made mandatory to include the disabled.
attributes.background:
Looking at figures of the employment sector it is noted that 80% of people without any health barrier are employed compared to people who have health barriers at shocking low of 43.6%.

Figures like these are shocking and need to be addressed such as employers attiude towards disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Below is a link of how supported employment can change and help a person with barriers make the economy and society whole.

This petition is the beginning of inclusion and wider understanding of disability towards recruitment processes within the private, public and self employed organisations.

https://www.mylondon.news/news/south-london-news/unsung-hero-who-helps-disabled-15510468

attributes.action: Ban the import and sale of badger hair in the UK.
attributes.background: Badger hair is often used in Britain because of certain water-retaining properties it has; however, the evidence is that animals suffer, at best, appalling living conditions, and at worst, terrible abuse and neglect, in order to produce this hair.
attributes.additional_details: Badger farms, predominantly in Asia, have been filmed keeping badgers in horrific conditions in order to produce hair for items like shaving brushes and paint brushes. When other options, like horse-hair, and artificial hair, is freely available, there is no reason to support this cruel industry in any way whatsoever, and the UK should take a lead in banning the use of this commodity.

attributes.action: The government need to put more money into road signs and cameras
attributes.background: I would like more things put in place to protect people not just on the moterways but on our streets and roads where we live. More money should be put into advanced technology for catching people speeding, like cameras on our roads, because they cost a lot it's very hard to get one on our streets.

attributes.action: Legalise “tactical contact” to end motorbike crimes, without prosecution.
attributes.background: Theft, robberies and all manner of recklessness involving motorcycles needs to stop. Police need to be able to use tactical contact to stop motorcyclists if they are known to have committed a crime. But they need to be free from prosecution or sueing.

attributes.action: Guarantee supply of & don't raise price on precription medicines after BREXIT
attributes.background:
I have a life long auto-immune disorder. One of my medicines is controlled, only released a month at a time. UK needs to ensure continuing supplies & fixed prices of medications following Brexit.

We need assurances that our essential medicines are available at a price we can reasonably afford.
attributes.additional_details:
The pharmaceutical industry is notoriously aggressive & profit oriented and we, the public, need to be protected from running out of, and being held over a barrel for vital medication following Brexit, especially if we are to leave the EMA.

https://www.ft.com/content/1bd3b34a-f390-11e7-88f7-5465a6ce1a00
https://www.ft.com/content/44304c7e-8461-11e8-96dd-fa565ec55929
https://www.pharmaceutical-journal.com/news-and-analysis/news/brexit-could-hinder-medicines-supply-to-uk-mps-told/20204082.article?firstPass=false

attributes.action: Review Drink/Drug driving laws and sentencing for offenders.
attributes.background:
Recently a man was sentenced to just 4 years in prison for killing a mother of 4 whilst over the prescribed limit for both alcohol and cocaine. 

The offender in this instance had already served a disqualification for being over the limits.
attributes.additional_details:
Current sentences for causing death or serious injury whilst over the prescribed limit are unfairly lenient.
 
Multiple convictions for over the prescribed limit should carry a lifetime driving ban.

Failure to provide a specimen - This is currently an easier option to hide the amount of alcohol in a persons’ system. It’s loophole which often results in a more lenient disqualification as intoxication levels cannot be established, this should be a mandatory 5 year disqualification.

attributes.action: Make this country a true democracy.
attributes.background:
Voting for an MP or a political party involves compromise since it is unlikely that either will precisely represent an individual's views on a range of issues.
The technology now exists for people to vote easily on any popular issue but the government is currently able to ignore those wishes.
attributes.additional_details:
1)	Make the government e-petitions website more widely publicised on a regular basis, on TV for instance 
2)	Make it mandatory for the government to hold a referendum where any petition requesting a referendum exceeds 100,000 signatures
3)	Make all referendums available online
4)	Make the results of the referendums mandatory. The government MUST act on them.

attributes.action: Fund monthly public transport for UK university students to visit home
attributes.background: As a university student, I see many of my peers unable to go home and see their friends and families for periods of up to 3 months due to financial difficulties, even in times of crisis. This impacts them emotionally and has a negative effect on their ability to work and concentrate effectively.
attributes.additional_details: Student finance should ensure students can visit home at least once a month.

attributes.action: Legalise the possession & use of Psilocybin Mushrooms for adults aged 18+.
attributes.background: Psilocybin mushrooms should not be classified as a Class A illegal drug alongside substances like heroin or cocaine. Studies suggest they are non-addictive, have incredible therapeutic value & have no long-term negative side effects.
attributes.additional_details: Psilocybin mushrooms have had documented use by mankind all over the world for hundreds if not thousands of years. They continue to be used today in religious or spiritual ceremony, as medicine or in recreational settings. Their classification as a Class A illegal substance in the UK is ludicrous, myopic and unjust. Consenting adults should be free to use these safe & naturally occurring, native or non-native fungi either as part of a spiritual practice, medicinally or in recreational settings.

attributes.action: Allow severely disabled children to remain in the care home they grew up in.
attributes.background: When children in care reach 18 years old they have to move on to adult services and have to move out of the care home they have grown up in and leave the carers who know them best. Changes need to be made to the relevant regulations for this to happen.

attributes.action: Change the law regarding organ donation so no consent required from next of kin
attributes.background: Last year my husband died. He was on the organ donor list yet they still required my consent as his next of kin to allow the donation procedure to be done. If i had declined consent they wouldn't be allowed to take his organs even though he himself had consented whilst alive. I find this very wrong
attributes.additional_details: The law currently requires that all  people on the organ donor register must have the permission of the next of kin after their death before the procedure can take place.I find this ridiculous. If you have made a choice whilst you are alive to donate your organs in the event of your death then how can it be that someone else, namely your next of kin,  can go against your wishes after your death.  This makes your choices whilst alive pretty pointless and meaningless and takes away your last wish
